It’s just the question to be answered by the thousands of socialites logging on…

It’s the in thing, the fad, the peer pressure, the cult, it’s the social networking community, and you need to be part of it or else you are out of it, so you got to grab a catchy username and dump in the profile with facts and fiction, upload a weird looking or a hot looking picture with the best touch up effects and spicy tag lines and launch your presence to shout out to the million odd members.

Finally you’ve arrived, and now you got to find the friends to fill up your friend list. Hitting the search button, browsing profiles and joining groups, you are quickly getting connected, and finally people are adding you and you are adding them, and popularity ratings for your profile are soaring high with hundreds of friends all lined up in your friend list , with no clue or reason. And it’s a chain effect till the point of it that everyone will be connected to each other in some way or the other.

Have you ever thought? Out of the hundreds or thousands of people you know, how many are contacting you and vice versa and have you or they, got a chance to speak to or meet you to know the real you, just as you don’t know the real they.

There’s too much to debate here, but cutting short the lingo, I think successful socializing is about making more quality and real friends than a big list of friends who are still strangers...

Happy Net logging!!!
